                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " will admit invalid values; whereas "
              ],
              [
                "ENUM",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " sets them to a special empty-string value (unless strict SQL mode is enabled, in which case they are rejected). Better data integrity can be achieved with "
              ],
              [
                "TINYINT",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " by making it a foreign key into a lookup table: which, with appropriate queries/joins, but there is still the small cost of reaching into the other table. ("
              ],
              [
                "FOREIGN KEYs",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " are not free.)"
